path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Techrate/Meta Shiba Full Smart Contract Security Audit.pdf

findings.title: Owner privileges (In the period when the owner is not renounced)
findings.description: The contract owner has excessive privileges to modify critical settings even after ownership renouncement.

findings.title: Owner can exclude/include in limit
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to include or exclude certain addresses in a limit, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Owner can change the tax and buy/sell fees
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to modify tax and buy/sell fees, which could lead to potential security risks.

findings.title: Owner can change the maximum balance amount
findings.description: The contract owner has the privilege to modify the maximum balance amount.

findings.title: Owner can change the number of tokens to add to liquidity
findings.description: The contract owner has the privilege to modify the number of tokens added to liquidity, which may lead to unintended consequences.

findings.title: Owner can enable/disable fees
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to enable or disable fees.

findings.title: Owner can exclude from the fee
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to exclude certain entities or transactions from fees.

findings.title: Owner can lock and unlock
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to lock and unlock, which could allow them to retake privileges even after ownership was renounced.
